metadata.titel_preek: Being Glad About Being A Christian

locutie.beschrijving: The sermon explores the nature of Christian joy as a wedding celebration, contrasting it with idiocy or denial, and grounding it in the presence of the Bridegroom (Jesus).
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: Moderate. The preacher uses the metaphor of the wedding feast correctly but quickly pivots to a topical exploration of joy in past, present, and future.

illocutie.beschrijving: The preacher moves from describing the nature of joy (Asserting) to testifying about God's presence (Expressing) and finally to assuring the congregation of God's faithfulness (Promising).
voorbeelden: Can the wedding guests fast while the bridegroom is with them?
The gladness of a Christian is structured and situated around Jesus Christ.
He has promised that he will get us all the way.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: To shift the hearer's mood from depression/legalism to celebratory confidence.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Implicit. The Spirit is not explicitly named as the agent of joy, though the 'presence of the Lord' is central.

voorbeelden: There is a certain suspicion on the part of many people.
The gladness of the Christian is neither the mindless grin of the idiot nor the smug smile.
Jesus Christ had made their lives a banquet.
Away with the gladness of idiots.
Don't you rest until you find it.
We have only to keep faith.
I, for one, am enjoying the presence and the power of the Lord right now.
We thank you, Father, for food and shelter.
I am glad that I am his.
He has promised that he will get us all the way.
The Lord has promised that he will guide until the day is done.
He shall deliver thee in six troubles.
commissieven.kwaliteit: Strongly grounded in the character of God, though often framed as 'He has promised' (Assertive) rather than 'He promises you now' (Commissive).

voorbeelden: The party's on.
The old account is settled.
The record is clear today.
declaratieven.autoriteit: The preacher declares a change in status (cleared record) based on the work of Christ, functioning sacramentally.

indicatoren: Extensive historical illustrations (Scarlett O'Hara, Madame Pompadour, Neville Chamberlain) create a 'talking about' distance.
Third-person descriptions of 'the disciples' and 'early Christian people'.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer becomes a spectator of historical joy rather than a participant in present grace.

missende_elementen: Direct address of the promise to the 'you' in the pews (often shifts to 'we').

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: High theological quality but often mediated through hymns or past-tense references.
voorbeelden: In Jesus the charge has been dropped, our record has been cleared.

eerste_persoon.gebruik: Used for personal testimony ('I, for one, am enjoying') and corporate identity ('We can be glad').

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Direct address used to challenge the hearer's mood ('It is what the Lord has done in your life').
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Used in the 'Don't you rest' directive.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Used for historical examples and general descriptions of 'Christians' or 'the worldling'.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: The long section on historical figures (Pompadour/Chamberlain) creates significant distance from the 'event'.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: General truths about what Christians 'ought' to be.

actueel_present.gebruik: The 'right now' blessings and the 'party's on' declaration.

foutief_patroon.beschrijving: The sermon avoids pure moralism (Assertive -> Directive).

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: Assertive (Christ as Bridegroom) -> Declarative (Record is cleared) -> Commissive (He will get us all the way).
voorbeelden: The old account is settled... we can be glad.
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: Strongest in the final third of the sermon.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: In Jesus the charge has been dropped... so we march on.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon functions primarily to comfort and reassure by testifying to God's past and present work, though it leans heavily on 'talking about' joy before 'performing' the joy.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: I, for one, am enjoying the presence and the power of the Lord right now.
sterke_punten.effect: Authenticates the message through the preacher's own experience.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The section on Madame Pompadour and Neville Chamberlain.
zwakke_punten.probleem: Historical distance dilutes the illocutionary force of the Gospel.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: The 'right now' focus in the latter half creates a sense of event, but the first half is largely a lecture on types of gladness.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The declaration 'the record is clear' is a high sacramental moment.

openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: Strongly felt in the rhythmic, authoritative 'Somewhere and somehow' section.

pneumatologie.geest_rol_erkend: Low. The Spirit is not mentioned.
pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: The preacher assumes the word will generate the joy it describes.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: Yes, the sermon treats the 'presence of the Lord' as something mediated through the preaching.
tekstueel_bewijs: In Jesus, regal good times roll.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: Shift from 'He has promised' (Assertive) to 'He promises you' (Commissive). Reduce historical 'talking about' by 50%.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: Christians are glad when they look back, for everything has been cleared.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: Look back at your life today: in Jesus Christ, I declare to you that your record is cleared.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Moves from a general truth about 'Christians' to a specific Declarative act for the hearer.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: Promises are often framed as historical facts or hymn lyrics.
toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Use the 1st person singular authority to deliver the promise.
voorbeeldzinnen: I promise you on the authority of God's Word: He will pick you up.

adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Address the 'depressed' hearer directly in the second person.
voorbeeldzinnen: You don't have to live in the swamp of sadness any longer.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.probleem: The balance is actually quite good.
indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: Maintain the current flow but strengthen the Declarative middle.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A powerful, rhythmic sermon that successfully moves from information to celebration, though it takes a long detour through historical 'constatives' to get there.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SvT would focus on the preacher's 'self-revelation' of joy; SAT focuses on the preacher's 'Declaration' of the cleared record as a reality-changing act.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: Rhetoric would praise the 'Somewhere and somehow' rhythm; SAT asks if that rhythm actually 'delivers' the promise it describes.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that the sermon's power is not in the Scarlett O'Hara illustration, but in the moment the preacher stops talking *about* joy and starts *promising* God's presence.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: In Jesus the charge has been dropped.
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: Excellent; it changes the hearer's status.

appendices.notities: The sermon relies heavily on the 'Black Preaching' tradition's rhythmic 'celebration' phase, which is inherently performative.
